p: Furthermore, reports are few on the cytotoxicity of brown seaweed Sargassum sp. against cancer cell lines, including human liver hepatocellular carcinoma (HepG-2), human breast adenocarcinoma (MCF-7), human prostate cancer (LnCaP), breast ductal carcinoma (T47D) cell lines, and Jurkat cancer [ 46â€“ 50] with variations in the inhibition rates. The differences of cytotoxicity activity among different species of seaweed may be due to differences in species, chemical compositions, time and method of sampling, and extraction procedure [ 51].
